description: Noun. sequential continuity (uncountable) (mathematical analysis) The property of a function between metric spaces, that given a convergent sequence , then. , i.e. the property of a function that it preserves sequential convergence.

name: [PDF] Sequential Continuitysites.math.washington.edu › ~morrow › continuity
description: Sequential Continuity. Theorem 1. Let S ⊂ Rn. Let a ∈ S and let f : S → Rm. Then f is continuous at a if and only if f(xn) → f(a) for all sequences xn ∈ S, xn → a.
